original: brtag par bya ba gzugs brnyan ni las su gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba gzugs brnyan ni las su gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the image that is the object of concentration is the object, and the mind that observes it is the agent,

original: ji ltar de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin par rung ste 'jig rten na byed pa po dang ; las ni tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin par rung ste 'jig rten na byed pa po dang ; las ni tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: how can it be correct that they are not different, because in the world agents and objects appear to be different?

original: yang dag par na tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par na tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that in reality they are not different,üîΩ.

original: byams pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMaitreya, in that regard‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni byed pa po bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni byed pa po bstan pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù indicates the agent.

original: gang la yang zhes bya ba ni las bstan pa yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir chos gcig pu ni 'ga' yang @322a * //
analyzed: gang la yang zhes bya ba ni las bstan pa yin te / gang gi phyir chos gcig pu ni 'ga' yang @322a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWherever‚Äù indicates the object.

original: med pas de'i phyir gang rtogs par byed pa dang / brtag par bya ba byed pa po dang / las su gyur ba gang yin /
analyzed: med pas de'i phyir gang rtogs par byed pa dang / brtag par bya ba byed pa po dang / las su gyur ba gang yin /
translated: Because there is not even a single phenomenon, therefore, what is the agent and what is the object that is to be understood and investigated?

original: yang dag par na /
analyzed: yang dag par na /
translated: In reality,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la /
translated: in terms of mind and mental factors,

original: rdul phrar ba re re ni mi snang ba'i phyir byed pa po dang / las kyi tha snyad kyang med la /
analyzed: rdul phrar ba re re ni mi snang ba'i phyir byed pa po dang / las kyi tha snyad kyang med la /
translated: since each atom is not apparent, there is no convention of agent and object.

original: 'dus pa dag la yang kun rdzob yin pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag la yang kun rdzob yin pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even in terms of their collection, it is conventional, because it is dependent and powerless.

original: yang dngos po rang dbang can ni 'ga' yang med pa yin na /
analyzed: yang dngos po rang dbang can ni 'ga' yang med pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if there is not even a single independent entity,

original: byed pa po la mngon par zhen pas bya ba dag 'jug par byed par zad de /
analyzed: byed pa po la mngon par zhen pas bya ba dag 'jug par byed par zad de /
translated: then it is merely the attachment to the agent that causes the engagement of actions.

original: byed pa po mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the agent is not tenable.

original: byed pa po dang las dang bya ba yang mi rigs so ;
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dang bya ba yang mi rigs so ;
translated: The agent, action, and instrument are not tenable.

original: /'on ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sems snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: /'on ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sems snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can the mind appear as the consciousness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject?

original: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Nevertheless, it is said that the mind that arises in that way appears in that way.

original: des 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can gzung ba dang / 'dzin par mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can gzung ba dang / 'dzin par mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: The consciousness that arises from the seed of consciousness, which is infused with the latent impressions of the expression of the apprehended object and apprehending subject since beginningless time, appears as the apprehended object and apprehending subject in that way.

original: don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that meaning,

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe ston to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe ston to //
translated: the example is taught beginning with ‚ÄúIt is thus.‚Äù

original: des 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba med mod kyi /
translated: Although the reflection does not arise in the surface of the mirror,

original: 'on kyang gzugs nyid 'khrul ba'i gzugs brnyan skyed par byed de des na gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs nyid 'khrul ba'i gzugs brnyan skyed par byed de des na gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems so zhes bstan to //
translated: nevertheless, the form itself produces the illusory reflection, and thus one thinks that one sees a reflection.

original: 'di la smra ba po dag gzhi me long gi dkyil 'khor nyid dang / mtshan ma gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan rdzas gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di la smra ba po dag gzhi me long gi dkyil 'khor nyid dang / mtshan ma gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan rdzas gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ste /
translated: Some say that the reflection arises from the mirror itself, which is the basis, and from the form, which is the sign, and that it is a different substance.

original: rten de byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rten de byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But if all that arises from that basis does not exist,

original: dpe 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: dpe 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: how can this example be appropriate?

original: 'dir de dag la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir de dag la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: To them it should be said:

original: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object other than the consciousness of the form and the reflection.

original: ji ltar don med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don med ce na /
translated: How is there no object?

original: don med kyang rnam par shes pa skye ba snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don med kyang rnam par shes pa skye ba snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because consciousness arises even though there is no object, as in a dream.üîΩAnd because consciousness arises even though there is no object, as in an eye disease.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam la sogs pa la don med par yang de'i rnam par shes pa skye ba mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam la sogs pa la don med par yang de'i rnam par shes pa skye ba mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, we see that consciousness arises in the aspect of past and future objects, and of objects in dreams, even though those objects do not exist.

original: yang don mtshungs pa la mos pa'i dbang gis rnam par rig pa tha dad @322b par dmigs pas kyang sems nyid gzugs brnyan du snang bar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: yang don mtshungs pa la mos pa'i dbang gis rnam par rig pa tha dad @322b par dmigs pas kyang sems nyid gzugs brnyan du snang bar nges pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is certain that mind itself appears as a reflection, because of the observation of different representations through the power of interest in similar objects.

original: dper na chu klung la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig la /
analyzed: dper na chu klung la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig la /
translated: For example, with regard to a single thing, such as a river,

original: dud 'gro rnams kyis ni gnas kyi rnam par mthong /
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyis ni gnas kyi rnam par mthong /
translated: animals see it as a place to live,

original: yi dags rnams kyis ni rnag la sogs pa'i rnam par mthong /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyis ni rnag la sogs pa'i rnam par mthong /

original: mi rnams kyis ni chu'i rnam par mthong ba lta bu dang / lha rnams kyis sa gzhi bee d'ur r+ya'i rang bzhin du mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni chu'i rnam par mthong ba lta bu dang / lha rnams kyis sa gzhi bee d'ur r+ya'i rang bzhin du mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: humans see it as water, and gods see it as a lapis lazuli walkway.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gnyis tha dad pa med kyang tha dad par snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gnyis tha dad pa med kyang tha dad par snang ba bzhin du /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù and so on shows that just as the two, the reflection and the reflected object, are not different, yet they appear as different,

original: nges par cig car snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par cig car snang ba'i phyir /
translated: because they appear simultaneously.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis tha mi dad pa nyid du grub po zhes nges par byed do //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis tha mi dad pa nyid du grub po zhes nges par byed do //
translated: Thus, the object and the subject are established as non-different.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúSentient beings‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
translated: ‚ÄúForm and so on‚Äù means the substances of blue and so on.

original: sems kyi gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni sems la snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni sems la snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMental images‚Äù means what appears to the mind.

original: rang bzhin du gnas par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally abiding‚Äù means abiding as the essence.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means external things.

original: sems dang tha dad pa ma lags pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: sems dang tha dad pa ma lags pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúNot different from the mind‚Äù means not different from karma, afflictions, and so on.

original: gang las shes pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: gang las shes pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom which‚Äù means from karma, afflictions, and Mara.

original: lam de yang bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i bye brag gis gsum char yang bzung ngo //
analyzed: lam de yang bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i bye brag gis gsum char yang bzung ngo //
translated: And that path is also threefold, by the distinctions of virtue, nonvirtue, and immobility, because it is not distinguished in particular.

original: de la mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa zhes bgyi'am zhes zhus pa dang / byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa zhes bgyi'am zhes zhus pa dang / byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: There it is asked, ‚ÄúIs it called nonvirtuous action and affliction?‚Äù and it is said, ‚ÄúMaitreya, it is not different.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci'i phyir tha dad par snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir tha dad par snang zhe na /
translated: Well then, why does it appear to be different?

original: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni gzugs brnyan de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni gzugs brnyan de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe childish, whose minds are mistaken, do not understand that those reflections are just representations, and so they are mistaken.‚Äù

original: des 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des 'di skad bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: byis pa de kho na ma mthong ba lta bu rab rib kyis nyams par byas pa rnams ni /
translated: It is taught that those childish beings who do not see reality, who are impaired by cataracts,

analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa bzhin du yod par mthong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: see external objects as existing, even though they do not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In response, it is said, When one attends continuously with the mind, etc.

analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems bya ba la bar chad ni bar du chod pa yin la / bar du chod pa med pa ni bar @323a * //

original: chad med pa yin te /
analyzed: chad med pa yin te /
translated: What is uninterrupted is uninterrupted.

analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nang du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: For example,üîΩthe phrase ‚Äúform is impermanent‚Äù is a collection of the names ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúimpermanent,‚Äù and ‚Äúis.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni ming rnams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni ming rnams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The aggregate of names is the names of the three realms of desire, form and formlessness.

original: rnam par byang ba pa'i ming gi tshogs kyang de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba pa'i ming gi tshogs kyang de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: The aggregate of names in the process of purification should be explained in the same way.

original: 'di lta ste sems can med pa'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems can med pa'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba la /
translated: For example, the aggregate of names is the names of the actions and results connected with the non-existence of sentient beings.

original: dad pa ni dge ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni dge ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Faith is wholesome.üîΩWhat are syllables? They are the syllables that are the basis of both of those.

original: yi ge gang zhe na de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yi ge'i 'bru gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming dang tshig gi gnas su gyur pa ni yi ge'i 'bru yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge gang zhe na de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yi ge'i 'bru gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming dang tshig gi gnas su gyur pa ni yi ge'i 'bru yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The syllables are the basis of names and phrases.

original: de dag so so las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag so so las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the teaching?

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: It is the knowledge of the teaching that arises from the mental attention to the unmixed teaching.üîΩThe knowledge of the teaching is the knowledge of the teaching that arises from the mental attention to the unmixed teaching.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge bkod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi tshig so sor nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge bkod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi tshig so sor nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to ;
translated: It is the retention of the words of the Dharma, such as the sutras, which are distinguished by their names, phrases, and letters.

original: / bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analytical knowledge of expression?üîΩIt is the analytical knowledge of expression which is the mental attention to the combined.

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos bsdus pa de dag nyid gcig tu byas te nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos bsdus pa de dag nyid gcig tu byas te nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the retention of those very Dharmas, such as the sutras, which are combined into one.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin pa de ltar rnam par bshad nas rnam pa du dag gis don so so yang dag par rig pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin pa de ltar rnam par bshad nas rnam pa du dag gis don so so yang dag par rig pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained how the bodhisattva's cultivation of serenity and insight is the analytical knowledge of the teaching, in order to demonstrate the analytical knowledge of meaning by its aspects, he says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva's analytical knowledge of meaning is due to ten aspects.

original: ji snyed yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Affliction is attachment, etc.üîΩPurification is faith, etc.üîΩThe ultimate of all the aspects of the differentiation of those afflictions and purifications is the existence of all that exists.

original: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba pa'i chos rnams la rnam pa rab tu dbye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni ji snyed yod pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba la kun nas nyon mongs paüîΩla ni 'dod @328b chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba pa'i chos rnams la rnam pa rab tu dbye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni ji snyed yod pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa la ni 'dod @328b chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat has said: Maitreya, the ultimate of all the aspects of the differentiation of the dharmas of affliction and purification is the existence of all that exists.üîΩAffliction is attachment, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba pas ni dad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba pas ni dad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Purification is faith, etc.üîΩThe ultimate of all the aspects of the differentiation of those afflictions and purifications is the existence of all that exists.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa de dag gi grangs kyi rnam pa ji snyed yod pa de dag gi rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa de ni ji snyed yod pa nyid yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa de dag gi grangs kyi rnam pa ji snyed yod pa de dag gi rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa de ni ji snyed yod pa nyid yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The Bhagavat has said: Maitreya, the ultimate of all the aspects of the differentiation of the dharmas of affliction and purification is the existence of all that exists.

original: phung po rnams kyi ni phung po lnga po dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phung po rnams lhag chad med par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi ni phung po lnga po dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phung po rnams lhag chad med par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates are included in the five aggregates, because the aggregates of defilement and purification are included without remainder.

original: nang gi skye mched drug po dag gis ni zab po bstan to //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug po dag gis ni zab po bstan to //
translated: The six internal sense bases are taught as the basis of the defilement of the world.üîΩThe six external sense bases are taught as the enjoyment of the world.

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag gis ni longs spyod pa bstan to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa grangs lngas bsdus pa dag kyang gzung bar bya'o //üîΩji snyed yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos ji snyed yod pa gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /

translated: The five faculties such as faith are also to be included in the five aggregates.üîΩThe reality of the multiplicity is that by which the existence of things is known, whether they be dharmas that are defiling or purifying.

original: rnam par byang ba pa yod par srid pa nyid ni ji snyed pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba pa yod par srid pa nyid ni ji snyed pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The existence of things is the reality of the multiplicity.

original: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin te zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba pa'i chos gang dag la rnam par dpyad pa'i gnas skabs na ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa yod par srid pa nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba pa'i chos gang dag la rnam par dpyad pa'i gnas skabs na ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa yod par srid pa nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to
translated: Those dharmas that are afflicted and purified, in the context of investigation, are just as they are, i.e., they are not otherwise.

analyzed: // de yang rnam pa bdun te zhes bya bas ni yang rab tu dbye ba bstan to //

translated: The suchness of representations is the mere representation of formations. This is because internal and external things are distinguished by mere representation.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa'i chos rnams dus la sogs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa'i chos rnams dus la sogs par gnas pa'o //
translated: The suchness of abidance is what I have taught as the truth of suffering. Abidance is the abiding of phenomena that are without a self in time and so on.

original: de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa rnams la sdug bsngal bar bden te mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa rnams la sdug bsngal bar bden te mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are truths of suffering for ƒÅryas because they are incompatible with it.

analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la log par bsgrub pa ni bdag med pa la bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa dang skye
translated: The reality of wrong practice is that which I have taught as the truth of origination.

original: ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: Wrong practice is the cause of the suffering of manifest action and rebirth, because it has the nature of delusion about selflessness, etc.üîΩThe reality of purification is that which I have taught as the truth of cessation.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa glo bur 'gags pa yin pas rnam par dag pa yin no //üîΩyang dag par grub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni las lam gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni log par bsgrub pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa glo bur 'gags pa yin pas rnam par dag pa yin no // yang dag par grub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni las lam gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni log par bsgrub pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is purification because the cessation of adventitious false imagination is that.üîΩThe reality of right practice is that which I have taught as the truth of the path.

original: bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i lam rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i lam rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Right practice is the pure path that is the pacification of delusion about self, etc., because it is the antidote to wrong practice.

original: byams pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid de dag gi khyad par gyi tshul bstan te /
analyzed: byams pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid de dag gi khyad par gyi tshul bstan te /
translated: The passage beginning Maitreya, that suchness... teaches the mode of the distinctions of those suchnesses.

original: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgya cher gsungs pa ni /üîΩsems can thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags brtas pa'i phyir /üîΩ'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgya cher gsungs pa ni / sems can thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags brtas pa'i phyir / 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pas /
translated: The passage beginning That which is the suchness of arising... teaches in detail that:üîΩ All sentient beings are equal and similar in terms of the suchness of arising, etc.,

original: mtshungs shing mnyam mo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mtshungs shing mnyam mo zhes bstan to //
translated: because the latent propensities of the view of the transitory collection are inflated.üîΩThat which is the suchness of characteristic and that which is the suchness of representation are equal and similar in all phenomena

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin bde ni chos thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i @329b mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /üîΩrnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin bde ni chos thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i @329b mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /üîΩrnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are characterized by the selflessness of persons and are distinguished by mere representation.

original: byams pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub gsum po dag go //
analyzed: byams pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub gsum po dag go //
translated: The line beginning ‚ÄúMaitreya, in that regard‚Äù refers to the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mtshungs shing mnyam par ston te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mtshungs shing mnyam par ston te /
translated: It shows that they are the same, that is, equal, in terms of their pure suchness.

original: de dag gi 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the same in terms of their nature of cessation.

original: de dag ma tshangs na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ma tshangs na ci'i phyir /
translated: If they are not the same, why is it that

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol bas ni chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyis sems can gyi don la 'jug par 'gyur la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol bas ma yin zhe na /
translated: the liberation of the buddhas, which is characterized by the Dharma body, engages in the welfare of sentient beings, but the liberation of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas does not?

original: sangs rgyas kyis rnam par grol ba ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis sna tshogs yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rnam par grol ba ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis sna tshogs yin la /
translated: The liberation of the buddhas is various due to the power of their former aspirations.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The liberation of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is not.

original: dper na gos mdud pa dang ma mdud pa dag mtshungs par tshon gyi snod du bcug kyang /
analyzed: dper na gos mdud pa dang ma mdud pa dag mtshungs par tshon gyi snod du bcug kyang /
translated: For example, it is like the difference between cloth that is knotted and cloth that is not, when they are both placed in a dye.

original: shugs kyi dbang gis na mdud pa rnams la ni tshon bkra bar snang la ma mdud pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyi dbang gis na mdud pa rnams la ni tshon bkra bar snang la ma mdud pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: By the power of the force, the colors appear in the knots, but not in the unknotted parts.

analyzed: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang chos kyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Maitreya, through the analytical knowledge of the meaning of reality, one overwhelms all phenomena and the signs of phenomena.

original: chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yin @335a * //
analyzed: chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yin @335a * //
translated: All the signs of phenomena and meanings are unreal imagination.

original: la / de'i gnyen po ni de bzhin nyid kyi don so sor yang dag par rig pa yin pas /
analyzed: la / de'i gnyen po ni de bzhin nyid kyi don so sor yang dag par rig pa yin pas /
translated: And its antidote is the analytical knowledge of the meaning of reality.

original: des de zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: des de zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Therefore, it overwhelms that.üîΩI do not say that it is to be overwhelmed by anything.

original: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni der lta ba'i mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yin pa'i phyir gang gis kyang zil gyis mi non to //
analyzed: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni der lta ba'i mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yin pa'i phyir gang gis kyang zil gyis mi non to //
translated: Because it is the antidote to all signs of views there, and because its focal object and aspect are not limited, it is not overwhelmed by anything.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bcom 'das kyis chab rnyog pa can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgya cher gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom 'das kyis chab rnyog pa can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgya cher gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavat extensively taught in the example of a vessel containing turbid water, etc.

original: sems la so sor brtag pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: sems la so sor brtag pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is the discernment of mind?üîΩWhat is reality?

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang las dgongs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gang las dgongs te /
translated: What is the meaning of taught?

original: bka' stsal lags zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa rnam pa gsum dang / de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun yod pas de'i phyir zhus so //
analyzed: bka' stsal lags zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa rnam pa gsum dang / de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun yod pas de'i phyir zhus so //
translated: The three kinds of discernment and the seven kinds of reality exist, therefore, he asked.

original: byams pa sems la so sor brtags pa gsum gyi phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: byams pa sems la so sor brtags pa gsum gyi phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Maitreya, it is because of the three kinds of discernment of mind, etc. This is taught:

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems la so sor brtags pa dang rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa yin pas /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems la so sor brtags pa dang rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa yin pas /
translated: The discernment of mind that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditative realization, and the reality of the representation are non-dual.

original: de'i phyir de las dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, that is the meaning.

original: yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of taught is the same.

original: byams pa'i le'u'i k'a ri ka //
analyzed: byams pa'i le'u'i k'a ri ka //
translated: The Chapter of Maitreya's Verses

original: / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa dang mtshan ma rnam par sel ba /üîΩchos dang don gyi mtshan ma zil gyis gnon pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma du ma zhig ni /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa dang mtshan ma rnam par sel ba / chos dang don gyi mtshan ma zil gyis gnon pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma du ma zhig ni /
translated: Blessed One, in that way, the bodhisattva who has the analytical knowledges of phenomena and meaning, who has eliminated the signs,

original: rnam par bsal dka' ba dag lags /
analyzed: rnam par bsal dka' ba dag lags /
translated: who has entered the overcoming of the signs of phenomena and meaning, has many signs that are difficult to eliminate.üîΩ How are they eliminated?

original: gang gis ni de dag rnam par sel lags zhes zhus pa dang / bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩchos dang don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshig dang / yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis ni de dag rnam par sel lags zhes zhus pa dang / bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // chos dang don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshig dang / yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ten, etc., are stated.üîΩ The various signs of words and letters that cause the analytical knowledges of phenomena and meaning are eliminated by the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid las ma gtogs pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid las ma gtogs pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other phenomenon called various signs of words and letters apart from the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su @335b 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su @335b 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sign of the continuity of arising, destruction, and abiding, which causes the understanding of the reality of abiding, is eliminated by the emptiness of characteristics and the emptiness of no beginning and no end.

original: 'du byed dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Abiding refers to the characteristics of arising, abiding, aging, and impermanence of the formations included in the three times.

original: de yang mtshan gzhi med pa'i phyir /üîΩmtshan nyid stong pa dang / mtshan gzhi med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mtshan gzhi med pa'i phyir / mtshan nyid stong pa dang / mtshan gzhi med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because there is no basis of characteristics,üîΩthe emptiness of characteristics and the emptiness of the beginningless and endless are taught.

original: mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid kyang stong pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid kyang stong pa yin te /
translated: Because there is no basis of characteristics, the characteristic of the basis of characteristics is also empty.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid gcig dang / tha dad pa bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid gcig dang / tha dad pa bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis of characteristics and the characteristic are free from being identical or different.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gal te mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las //
translated: If the characteristic is different from the characterized,

original: gzhan na mtshan gzhi mtshan med 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan na mtshan gzhi mtshan med 'gyur //
translated: the characterized would be without a characteristic.

original: gcig na gnyi ga'i dngos med ces //üîΩyang dag gsung ba khyod kyis gsungs //
analyzed: gcig na gnyi ga'i dngos med ces // yang dag gsung ba khyod kyis gsungs //
translated: If they are the same, both would be unreal.

original: zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is what you have said, O One of Perfect Speech.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pa ste /
translated: The nonexistence of a beginning and end is the nonexistence of a prior limit and a later limit.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pa la ni yang dag par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pa la ni yang dag par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is situated in the nonexistence of a prior limit and a later limit does not exist.üîΩThe sign of the view of the transitory aggregates that generates the understanding of the object of grasping is the sign of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩThis is eliminated by the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the nonapprehension of an object.

original: 'dzin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid dang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la 'dzin pa ni mig la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid dang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la 'dzin pa ni mig la sogs pa dang /
translated: Grasping refers to the eye, etc.,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: and the mind and mental factors.

original: de la bdag dang bdag gi 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang zag tu snang ba gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gi 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang zag tu snang ba gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The sign of the apprehension of self and of what belongs to the self, which appears as the internal, is empty by reason of internal emptiness, and is empty by reason of the emptiness of nonapprehension,

original: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the nonapprehension of an intrinsic nature.üîΩThe sign of the view of enjoyment of the object of apprehension, which is the individual correct intuitive wisdom, is eliminated by the emptiness of generality.

original: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni spyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol na snang ba dag ste
analyzed: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni spyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol na snang ba dag ste
translated: The apprehension is the external appearances of form, etc.

original: / de dag ni rdul phra ra ba re re dang / bsdus pa dag la stong pa yin te /
analyzed: / de dag ni rdul phra ra ba re re dang / bsdus pa dag la stong pa yin te /
translated: They are empty in the individual atoms and in the aggregates,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs yul du snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs yul du snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable that the essence of the appearance of color and shape as an object should be their intrinsic reality.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du skyes pa dang bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang yo byad ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du skyes pa dang bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang yo byad ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The internal signs of pleasure and the external signs of beauty that are endowed with the service and supplies of men and women for the sake of complete enjoyment are eliminated by the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong @336a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong @336a * //
translated: They are eliminated by the emptiness of essence and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni log pa'i tshor ba la mos pa'o //üîΩphyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni log pa'i tshor ba la mos pa'o // phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The internal signs of pleasure are the adherence to false feelings.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyi lus la log par mos pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyi lus la log par mos pa ste /
translated: The external signs of beauty are the adherence to the bodies of men and women.

original: de ni rmi lam la sogs pa log par mos pa bzhin du stong pa yin te /üîΩnang dang phyi rol la mos pa de'i rang bzhin de ni stong pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rmi lam la sogs pa log par mos pa bzhin du stong pa yin te / nang dang phyi rol la mos pa de'i rang bzhin de ni stong pa yin te /
translated: They are empty like the adherence to false dreams, etc.

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that adherence to the inner and the outer is empty, because it is not produced from the beginning.

original: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa ni nam mkha'i khams
analyzed: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa ni nam mkha'i khams
translated: The accomplishment of immeasurable world systems is like the realm of space,

original: dang 'dra bar chen po stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang 'dra bar chen po stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of the emptiness of the great.

original: de ltar gzugs med pa la brten te /üîΩnang gi zhi ba rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs med pa la brten te / nang gi zhi ba rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, based on the formless realm,üîΩthe sign of liberation that is inner peace is eliminated by the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas gang yin pa ci yang rung ba de ni stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas gang yin pa ci yang rung ba de ni stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Whatever is conditioned is empty,

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on causes and conditions.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The sign of the selflessness of persons that causes the realization of the suchness of the characteristics, the sign of the selflessness of phenomena, the sign of cognition, and the sign of the ultimate are eliminated by the emptiness that transcends extremes,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la / gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: the emptiness of the nature of nonentities, the emptiness of the nature of nonentities, and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: gang zag yod na ni gang zag dgag pa yang rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag yod na ni gang zag dgag pa yang rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sign of the selflessness of persons is empty of the emptiness that transcends extremes because if persons existed, it would be logical to refute persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The sign of the selflessness of phenomena is empty of the emptiness of nonentities because if phenomena existed, it would be logical to refute phenomena.

original: chos rnams yod na ni chos dgag pa yang yod do //
analyzed: chos rnams yod na ni chos dgag pa yang yod do //
translated: If phenomena existed, then the cessation of phenomena would also exist.

original: rnam par rig pa com gyi mtshan ma ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa com gyi mtshan ma ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The sign of the non-existence of the object is empty of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: The nature of error is a representation

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin te /
translated: that is only the essential nature of non-existence.

original: gnyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the duality is not established.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan ma ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan ma ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The sign of the ultimate is empty of the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: dgag @336b par bya ba dang 'gog par byed pa gnyis don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'gog par byed pa nam yang gsal bar byed pa yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: dgag @336b par bya ba dang 'gog par byed pa gnyis don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'gog par byed pa nam yang gsal bar byed pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Because the object of negation and the negating agent are not the ultimate, because the object of negation does not exist, and because the negating agent is never a clarifier,

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid rtogs pa las gzhan pa don dam pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid rtogs pa las gzhan pa don dam pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: therefore, apart from the realization of emptiness, there is no other ultimate at all.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /üîΩ'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la rnam pa dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la rnam pa dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The sign of the unconditioned and the sign of the unchanging which cause the understanding of the meaning of the suchness of purificationüîΩare eliminated by the emptiness of the unconditioned and the emptiness of the non-rejectable.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The suchness of purification is the truth of cessation.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas pa dang 'gyur ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas pa dang 'gyur ba med pa yin la /
translated: It is unconditioned and unchanging.

original: 'dus ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa de gnyis kyi mtshan ma gzung ba de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa de gnyis kyi mtshan ma gzung ba de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: The apprehension of the sign of those two, the unconditioned and the unchanging, is eliminated by the emptiness of the unconditioned and the emptiness of the non-rejectable.

original: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de nyid la byed pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid shes pa gang gis mtshan ma thams cad rnam
analyzed: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de nyid la byed pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid shes pa gang gis mtshan ma thams cad rnam
translated: The sign of emptiness that is the antidote to that sign is eliminated by the emptiness of emptiness.

original: par sel bar byed pa de yang stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par sel bar byed pa de yang stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is, the emptiness of that emptiness by which one eliminates all signs is also empty.

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavat extensively declares, ‚ÄúWhen eliminating the ten signs,‚Äù and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed pa ni gnyen po yin la /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: byams pa stong pa nyid de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don re re yang mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen por mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kyang rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa yin no
analyzed: byams pa stong pa nyid de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don re re yang mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen por mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kyang rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa yin no

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩgdags pa zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir / gdags pa zhus te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes na theg pa chen po la chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: @337a * // legs so legs so bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: stong pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa yin no //

analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyu rtogs par byas nas 'bras bu zhu ba'i phyir /

analyzed: las ci lags zhes bya ba gsol to /

analyzed: byams pa 'ching ba rnam par gnyis po las rnam par thar bar byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa la 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po de gang dag las mnyam pa la /

original: 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po de dag las /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po de dag las /

original: sbyor ba mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gnod sems zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Malice is

analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa ni /

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pa ni /
