translated: This is the time for vipa≈õyanƒÅ, not the time for ≈õamatha.

original: 'di ni zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi dus yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi dus yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the time of the path of union.

original: de ltar dus ji ltar bya ba bzhin gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gags dang sgrib pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de la /
analyzed: de ltar dus ji ltar bya ba bzhin gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gags dang sgrib pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de la /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who abides in the proper time, purifying his mind from obstructions, obscurations, and distractions,

original: ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what will occur?

original: nang gi so so bdag nyid la so so rang gis rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtog pa shes pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi so so bdag nyid la so so rang gis rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtog pa shes pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The seven kinds of knowledge of discernment of the suchness that is individually realized within oneself will arise.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyis chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyis chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are included in the seven kinds of suchness.

original: so @340b so rang rig pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: so @340b so rang rig pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: The seven kinds of knowledge of discernment are the bodhisattva‚Äôs path of seeing. Therefore,

original: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said that this is his path of seeing.

original: de thob pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag pa nyid kyi skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nar de kho na mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de thob pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag pa nyid kyi skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nar de kho na mthong ba'o //
translated: Also, having attained that and so on. The faultless state of reality is the first seeing of reality.

original: sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la phan yon gang dag bstan pa de dag nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la phan yon gang dag bstan pa de dag nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And he experiences the benefits of that stage means that he experiences the benefits of the bodhisattva that were taught on the first stage.

original: des sngar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des sngar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By he previously refers to

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa mthong ba'i lam 'thob pa'i snga rol te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa mthong ba'i lam 'thob pa'i snga rol te /
translated: the bodhisattva prior to attaining the path of seeing,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: on the stage of action out of faith.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis 'thob pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis 'thob pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The attainment of the object of the reflected image with discrimination and the attainment of the object of the nondiscriminative reflected image are called the attainment of the two.

original: de ltar ni mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyis chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang rtogs par bya ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtha' ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku yin /
analyzed: de ltar ni mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyis chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang rtogs par bya ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtha' ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku yin /
translated: The ultimate reality is the Dharma Body which is to be realized, because one realizes the realm of Dharma by the meaning of going everywhere, because one does not perceive the reality of the basis of defilement and purification, and because one has reached the limit of what is to be realized.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi dmigs pa chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa de thob pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi dmigs pa chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa de thob pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva who is on the path of insight attains the object of the ultimate reality, which is the essence of the Dharma Body, the object of the path of union.

original: des gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase he enters the path of cultivation in the higher stages refers to the second stage and so on.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase when he attends to those three kinds of objects refers to the three kinds of objects of the path of cultivation.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' nyid do //
translated: the image with conceptual differentiation, the image without conceptual differentiation, and the very limit of reality.

original: mtshan ma phra mo de gsum nang du yid la byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo de gsum nang du yid la byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: These three subtle signs are mental activities that occur internally.

original: dper na la la zhig khye'u ches phra mos khye'u ches sbom po 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig khye'u ches phra mos khye'u ches sbom po 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du yang /
translated: For example, just as a small child removes a large child from his mother's lap,

original: khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du nang gi mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba ni rim gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de //
analyzed: khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du nang gi mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba ni rim gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de //
translated: so too, the internal signs are removed in the manner of a child removing a child.

original: mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba na /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba na /
translated: In the process of removing the signs,

original: gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar @341a * //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar @341a * //
translated: the negative reflex actions are also removed.

original: byed do zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon dag ni mtshan ma rnams so //
analyzed: byed do zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon dag ni mtshan ma rnams so //
translated: The signs are the faults such as passion, etc.

original: lta ba dag ni gnas ngan len rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba dag ni gnas ngan len rnams so //
translated: The negative reflex actions are the views.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs par bcom pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs par bcom pas /
translated: And since all signs and negative tendencies are thoroughly destroyed,

original: rim gyis gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim gyis gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the mind is progressively purified in the higher and higher levels, like gold.

original: dper na gser gser mgar gyis gong nas gong du sbyong ba'i las kyis yongs su sbyong bar byed pa na /üîΩches 'od gsal bar 'gyur zhing de las gzhan pa'i sa le sbram dag gis mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du sa gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la /
analyzed: dper na gser gser mgar gyis gong nas gong du sbyong ba'i las kyis yongs su sbyong bar byed pa na / ches 'od gsal bar 'gyur zhing de las gzhan pa'i sa le sbram dag gis mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du sa gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la /
translated: Just as gold is purified by a goldsmith through the process of refining it,

original: glo bur gyi dri ma thams cad dang bral bas sems las su rung bas ches 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma thams cad dang bral bas sems las su rung bas ches 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: so too, on the path of meditation, the mind becomes increasingly radiant, free of all adventitious contaminants, and pliable, in the higher and higher levels.

original: de ltar tshul des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob ste zhes bya ba la dgongs pa yongs su grub pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi
analyzed: de ltar tshul des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob ste zhes bya ba la dgongs pa yongs su grub pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi
translated: In this way, by this method, up to fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and also attaining the object of accomplishing the purpose,

original: don bya ba'i rjes su song bas chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: don bya ba'i rjes su song bas chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba brnyes pa'o //
translated: the accomplishment of the purpose is the attainment of the knowledge and seeing that is unattached and unobstructed, in accordance with the activities for the benefit of self and others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa la /
translated: With regard to the question, ‚ÄúHow do bodhisattvas practice?‚Äù and so on,

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gnas drug la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gnas drug la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Maitreya said, ‚ÄúBodhisattvas who are skilled in six topics

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: are those who accomplish the great power of bodhisattvas.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / bslang ba dang / 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / bslang ba dang / 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in the arising, abiding, and passing away of mind, and who is skilled in the increase and decrease of mind, and who is skilled in the means,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: will accomplish the great power of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub pa ni /
translated: The great power of the bodhisattva is accomplished

original: sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: because it depends on the arising, etc. of mind.

original: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in the arising of mind?

original: sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug shes na /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug shes na /
translated: If one knows the sixteen aspects of the arising of mind,

original: sems kyi skye ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa yin te zhes bya ba la gsungs so //üîΩbrtan pa dang snod rnam par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la brtan pa rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon thams cad pa /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa yin te zhes bya ba la gsungs so // brtan pa dang snod rnam par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la brtan pa rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon thams cad pa /
translated: one is skilled in the arising of mind just as it is.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of the stable and the vessel is said to be the cognition of the stable, which is the consciousness that is the seed of everything, the foundation consciousness.

original: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos @341b rnams kyi bag chags bsgo bar bya ba yin pas brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos @341b rnams kyi bag chags bsgo bar bya ba yin pas brtan pa yin no //
translated: It is stable because it is the place where the propensities of the dharmas of defilement and purification are stored.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni g-yo ba'i phyir bag chags bsgo bar bya ba ma yin gyi bag chags bsgo bar byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni g-yo ba'i phyir bag chags bsgo bar bya ba ma yin gyi bag chags bsgo bar byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: The active consciousnesses are not the place where the propensities are stored because they are unstable, but they are the agents that store the propensities.

original: de dag ni dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are by nature virtuous, etc.

original: snod rnam par rig pa ni gnas te /üîΩbrtan pa rnam par rig pa dang / snod rnam par rig pa de gnyis ni /
analyzed: snod rnam par rig pa ni gnas te / brtan pa rnam par rig pa dang / snod rnam par rig pa de gnyis ni /
translated: The representation of the receptacle is the place.

original: rnam pa dang dmigs pa yongs su ma chad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang dmigs pa yongs su ma chad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa yin no //
translated: These two, the representation of the stable and the representation of the receptacle, are ignorance because their aspects and objects are not discriminated.

original: sems de'i skye ba gang yin pa de ni brtan pa dang snod rnam par rig pa mi rig pa'i sems skye ba yin no //
analyzed: sems de'i skye ba gang yin pa de ni brtan pa dang snod rnam par rig pa mi rig pa'i sems skye ba yin no //
translated: The arising of that mind is the arising of the mind of ignorance, which is the representation of the stable and the receptacle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la mkhas pa ni chos thams cad 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sgrib pa dang gnas ngan len thams cad bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la mkhas pa ni chos thams cad 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sgrib pa dang gnas ngan len thams cad bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in that

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: accomplishes the great power of a bodhisattva in order to remove the obscurations of the container consciousness that perceives the mixture of all phenomena and all the negative tendencies.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The various kinds of objects are cognized, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it simultaneously apprehends objects such as form, etc.,

original: dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa yin no //
translated: it cognizes the various kinds of objects.

original: nges par rtogs pa dang rjes su dran par nus pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa dang rjes su dran par nus pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: It is conceptual because it is able to understand and remember.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams shes par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams shes par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: It is mental consciousness because it is the nature of the consciousness that causes the entry of the consciousnesses.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la mkhas pa ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad la yang sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la mkhas pa ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad la yang sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in that, etc., should be understood as applying to all.

original: phyi rol dang nang gi yul cig car 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi yul cig car 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Simultaneous apprehension of external and internal objects.

original: phyi rol gyi yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: External objects are form, etc.

original: nang gi yul ni dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi yul ni dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Internal objects are the objective supports, etc.

original: de dag thams cad dus gcig tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa can te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad dus gcig tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa can te /
translated: The simultaneous apprehension of all of them is the conceptual mental consciousness.

original: de'i skye ba la mkhas pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i skye ba la mkhas pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Skill in its arising is as before.üîΩIn one moment, one instant, one brief moment, etc.,

original: skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas skad cig gcig la cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug
analyzed: skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas skad cig gcig la cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug
translated: the bodhisattva, by means of the mental consciousness cultivating serenity and insight, simultaneously enters many concentrations in one moment.

original: pa ni re zhig rung ste /
analyzed: pa ni re zhig rung ste /
translated: This is possible,

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nang du 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nang du 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because concentration is internal.

original: skad cig gcig la phyogs tha dad pa na rnam par gnas @342a * //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la phyogs tha dad pa na rnam par gnas @342a * //
translated: In one moment, he simultaneously enters many concentrations in different places.

original: pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis mthong bar rung ste /
analyzed: pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis mthong bar rung ste /
translated: and the many buddhafields and many tathagatas that are seen, it is proper that they are seen by that mental consciousness itself.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs snang ba rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na rung ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs snang ba rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na rung ste /
translated: Because the appearances of external form are the objects of eye consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Because all operative consciousnesses are the objects of mental consciousness, mental consciousness is various and has many aspects and is conceptual.

original: de nyid gnas de dang de nas 'jug pa na de dang de'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: de nyid gnas de dang de nas 'jug pa na de dang de'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: When it engages in this or that object, it obtains the name of that object.

original: dper na sems pa lus dang ngag gi las bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na sems pa lus dang ngag gi las bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like intention being called bodily or verbal action.

original: sems pa nyid bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid lus dang ngag gi las shes par bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems pa nyid bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid lus dang ngag gi las shes par bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Intention itself is known as bodily or verbal action, which is characterized by meritorious, nonmeritorious and unwavering compositional activity.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi yongs su dag pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi yongs su dag pa de nyid kyis /
translated: The mental consciousness is purified by means of calm abiding and profound insight.

original: skad cig gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mang po mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skye ba rnam pa sna tshogs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mang po mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skye ba rnam pa sna tshogs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who, by means of the mental consciousness purified by serenity and insight, sees in a single moment many buddha-fields and many lord buddhas, should be known as skilled in the various kinds of mental processes.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung ngu rnam par rig pa'i yang sems skye ba'i dbang du mdzad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung ngu rnam par rig pa'i yang sems skye ba'i dbang du mdzad pa kho na'o //
translated: The small objective images are also only in terms of the arising of the mind.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩ'dod pa dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung ngu yin no //
translated: those of the desire realm. The arising of the mind associated with the desire realm is of small objective images because it is the level of non-concentration.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chen por gyur pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chen por gyur pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The great objective images are, for example,üîΩthose of the form realm. The arising of the mind associated with the form realm is of great objective images because it is the level of concentration.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is associated with form‚Äù refers to the mind that is born in the form realm.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: The object-perception of that mind is a great sign because it is a mind that is extremely well-concentrated.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chad med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chad med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is associated with the infinite perception of the sign of the object‚Äù refers to

original: nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: the mind that is born in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam du snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba las sems skye ba gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir @342b dmigs pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam du snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba las sems skye ba gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir @342b dmigs pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa yin no //
translated: The object-perception of that mind is an infinite sign because it is a mind that is born in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is associated with the subtle perception of the sign of the object‚Äù refers toüîΩthe mind that is born in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis ci yang med do snyam du mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa las sems skye ba gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra moüîΩrnam par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis ci yang med do snyam du mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa las sems skye ba gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo rnam par rig pa yin no //
translated: The mind that arises from the subtle sign of the sphere of nothingness, thinking ‚Äúthere is nothing at all,‚Äù through the mind possessing the view of the transitory collection is the subtle sign of the object.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind that arises from the ultimate sign of the object is as follows.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mind that arises from the ultimate sign of the object of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is as follows.

original: khams dang gnas dang 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthar thug pa las /
analyzed: khams dang gnas dang 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthar thug pa las /
translated: From the ultimate of the realms, abodes, and mundane meditative attainments,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the mind that arises from the ultimate sign of the object is the ultimate sign of the object.

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind that arises from the signless object is as follows.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye ba ni mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye ba ni mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa yin no //
translated: The supramundane and that which has cessation as its object. The supramundane mind is the cognition of signlessness, because it is the antidote to all signs.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems skye ba yang de bzhin no //üîΩsdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems skye ba yang de bzhin no // sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind that has cessation as its object is also like that.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i'o zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems skye ba ni bde ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yin no //üîΩtshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i'o zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems skye ba ni bde ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yin no // tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind that is associated with suffering is like that of the sentient beings in the hells. The mind that arises in the hells is associated with suffering, because it is not mixed with pleasure.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba 'dren ma'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba 'dren ma'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The mind that is associated with mixed feelings is like that of the sentient beings in the desire realm. The mind that arises in the desire realm is associated with mixed feelings, because it is associated with the feelings of pleasure, suffering, and neither pleasure nor suffering.üîΩThe mind that is associated with neither pleasure nor suffering is like that of the sentient beings in the form and formless realms. The mind that arises in the form and formless realms is associated with neither pleasure nor suffering, because it is associated with the feeling of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni las kyi rnam par smin pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni las kyi rnam par smin pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the desire realm is associated with the various karmic maturations.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩbsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa gnyis la ni /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa ni 'di lta ste / bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa gnyis la ni /
translated: The desire realm is not associated with pleasure because it is associated with the various karmic maturations of karma.üîΩThat associated with pleasure is the first and second absorptions.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first and second absorptions are associated with pleasure because the mind arises there endowed with pleasure born of seclusion.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /üîΩbsam gtan gsum pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa la ni nang yongs su dang ba las /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste / bsam gtan gsum pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa la ni nang yongs su dang ba las /
translated: That associated with pleasure is the third absorption.

original: sems las byung ba bde ba skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba bde ba skye ba'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third absorption is associated with pleasure because mental satisfaction arises there born of the internal clarity of mind.üîΩThat associated with neither pleasure nor suffering is the fourth absorption and the perception-¬≠sphere of neither

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes @343a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes @343a * //
translated: perception nor nonperception.

original: med min skye mched kyi bar gyi'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ni skyon rnam pa brgyad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med min skye mched kyi bar gyi'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ni skyon rnam pa brgyad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The mental application of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the mental application of the fourth absorption and above, because it is free from the eight faults.

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems skye'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems skye'o //
translated: The mind arises endowed with equanimity.

original: skyon rnam pa brgyad ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: skyon rnam pa brgyad ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The eight faults are: initial and sustained thought, inhalation and exhalation of breath, pleasure and pain, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mental application of those possessing affliction is as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩnyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mental application of those possessing affliction and secondary affliction.üîΩAfflictions are attachment and so on.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni khro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni khro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Secondary afflictions are anger and so on.

original: dge ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog dang / bden pa dang / las dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog dang / bden pa dang / las dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That associated with virtue is, for example, that associated with faith, etc. This means that a mind arises that is associated with faith, etc., in the Jewels, the Truths, karma and its results.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: That associated with the indeterminate is

original: de gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa byed pa'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa byed pa'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that which is not associated with either of those two. This means that a mind arises that is born of karmic maturation, that arises from deportment, that arises from craftsmanship, and that creates emanations.

original: de ltar sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad nas ji ltar gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad nas ji ltar gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Having explained the skill in the arising of mind in this way, how is one skilled in abiding?

original: sems kyi gnas pa la mkhas pa la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas pa la mkhas pa la 'jug par byed de /
translated: He introduces the skill in the abiding of mind.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed rnam par rig pa tsam du rab tu shes pa ni sems kyi gnas pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed rnam par rig pa tsam du rab tu shes pa ni sems kyi gnas pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: If it is said that the suchness of cognition is the correct understanding of things as they are, then the bodhisattva‚Äôs understanding of formations as mere cognition is skill in mental abiding.

original: sems kyi gnas pa la mkhas pa na /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas pa la mkhas pa na /
translated: When there is skill in mental abiding,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes ston to //
translated: it is taught that the bodhisattva accomplishes great power.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the suchness of cognition?

original: rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi de tsam nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi de tsam nyid de /
translated: It is the mere thatness of all cognitions,

original: don dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of objects.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i sems kyi gnas pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin par rung na /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i sems kyi gnas pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin par rung na /
translated: Mental abiding in dreams, etc., is suitable as mere cognition.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam du rung zhe @343b na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam du rung zhe @343b na /
translated: But how are cognitions such as eye consciousness and physical cognitions such as the eye suitable as mere cognition?

original: rnam par rig pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lta ba thams cad ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lta ba thams cad ni /
translated: All the views of the representations of consciousness

original: don med par yang gnyis nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: don med par yang gnyis nyid du snang ste /
translated: appear as duality, although they are without an object.

original: mig gi rnam par rig pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par rig pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The representations of eye-consciousness, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / de'i rnam par shes pa'i lta ba dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi lta bas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / de'i rnam par shes pa'i lta ba dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi lta bas so //
translated: are views of the representations of form, etc., and of the representations of the consciousness of the body.

original: yid kyi rnam par rig pa ni mig la sogs pa chos kyi mthar thug pa'i rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pas lta ba dang bcas pa dag yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par rig pa ni mig la sogs pa chos kyi mthar thug pa'i rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pas lta ba dang bcas pa dag yin te /
translated: The representations of mind are views of the representations of all the representations of consciousness, from the eye up to the mental faculty, together with their signs, and of the representations of mental consciousness.

original: mtshan ma dang lta ba ni phyin ci log la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang lta ba ni phyin ci log la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin no //
translated: The signs and views are the basis of the abode of defilement, such as error, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na ni don med pa la don du phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba dang / de med na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med par 'gyur ba dang / de med na rnam par byang ba yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni don med pa la don du phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba dang / de med na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med par 'gyur ba dang / de med na rnam par byang ba yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then there would be no error in the non-existent being taken as the existent, and if that were not so, then there would be no defilement of the obscurations of afflictions and the knowable, and if that were not so, then there would be the fault that there would be no purification.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid /
translated: The suchness of consciousness

original: de tsam nyid yin par rigs pa dang lung gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam nyid yin par rigs pa dang lung gis rig par bya'o //
translated: is to be understood by reasoning and scripture as being just that much.

original: sems kyi gnas pa rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas pa rnam par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the abiding of mind,

original: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kyi bslang ba ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kyi bslang ba ston to //
translated: how is one skilled in the arising of mind?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / 'jig tshogs la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las sems 'di ni 'di las bslang bar bya'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / 'jig tshogs la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las sems 'di ni 'di las bslang bar bya'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pas /
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in the arousing of mind, by means of the correct knowledge that this mind is to be aroused from the bondage of the signs of the afflictions such as passion, and from the bondage of the negative reflex actions of the afflictions such as the false view of individuality,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: accomplishes the great power of the bodhisattva.

original: sems kyi bslang ba rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: sems kyi bslang ba rnam par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the arousing of mind,

original: ji ltar 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kyi 'phel ba ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kyi 'phel ba ston to //
translated: how is one skilled in its increase? The increase of mind is shown by the question beginning with ‚ÄúHow is one skilled in its increase?‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de skye ba dang / 'phel ba'i tshe skye'o 'phel lo zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba'i gnyen por gyur ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bas /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de skye ba dang / 'phel ba'i tshe skye'o 'phel lo zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba'i gnyen por gyur ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bas /
translated: If the mind that is the antidote to signs and negative tendencies arises and increases, one is skilled in knowing that it arises and increases.

original: 'jug pa'i mtshan ma 'phel ba na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mtshan ma 'phel ba na /
translated: When the sign of engagement increases,

original: 'phel lo zhes 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin @344a * //
analyzed: 'phel lo zhes 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin @344a * //
translated: one is skilled in knowing that it increases.
